title: How to Escape Prison in BitLife: Complete Gameplay Guide

steps.title: Tap the Prison button.
steps.content: Tap the Prison button. Besides Age , it's the only button available, located in the first spot on the gray bar above your stats.

steps.title: Tap Escape.
steps.content: Tap Escape . The game will ask if you want to confirm your escape attempt. Tap Yes to continue.

steps.title: Tap the arrow buttons to move.
steps.content: Tap the arrow buttons to move. You must move towards the exit and outrun the guard to escape prison. For every move you make, the guard will make 2 moves towards you in the same direction.

steps.title: Get to the "exit" sign to escape prison.
steps.content: Get to the "exit" sign to escape prison. Once you escape, you can attempt to return to your normal life. If you're caught, you can try again after aging up one year. Getting caught will increase your sentence by at least 1 year.

steps.title: When you try escaping prison, the guard can only move certain ways.
steps.content: When you try escaping prison, the guard can only move certain ways. For every one move you make, the guard will make two moves. The guard will also move towards your character, but will prioritize horizontal moves over vertical moves. [1] X Research source This means if you can get the guard into a spot where there is a wall above him, he will get trapped and you'll be able to create enough distance to escape.

steps.title: There are 14 minimum security prison layouts and 9 maximum security layouts.
steps.content: There are 14 minimum security prison layouts and 9 maximum security layouts. The minimum security layouts range from a 3x4 grid to a 7x4 grid, and all but one of the maximum security layouts are 8x8 (the one outlier is an 8x7 layout). While this sounds like a lot, many of the layouts are repeats of one another, just flipped horizontally or vertically. In each layout, there will be a star noting your starting spot, an "exit" sign designating the exit, and a policeman emoji for the guard's location. The thick, dark lines are walls you can't walk through.

steps.title: You can watch an ad to skip the prison break minigame once per life.
steps.content: You can watch an ad to skip the prison break minigame once per life. If you haven't escaped prison before in your current character's life, you can skip the prison escape minigame one time (per life) by tapping the Steal a guard's uniform to escape! button. If you end up going back to prison, you'll have to escape by completing the minigame.

steps.title: An alternative method of escape is escaping in a riot.
steps.content: An alternative method of escape is escaping in a riot. It's rare that you can escape in a riot, but it is possible. This is usually achieved if you have more than 25 prisoners participating in the riot.

steps.title: There are three achievements for escaping prison.
steps.content: There are three achievements for escaping prison. The achievements are as follows: [2] X Research source Escape Artist: Escape from prison once Theseus: Escape from a maximum-security prison once Aftermath: Escape during a prison riot

steps.title: There are three death ribbons you can get after escaping prison.
steps.content: There are three death ribbons you can get after escaping prison. These ribbons and how to get them are as follows: [3] X Research source bitlife-life-simulator.fandom.com/wiki/Ribbon Cunning: One of the ways you can get this death ribbon is by escaping prison by completing a difficult minigame puzzle Houdini: Escape from prison at least 10 times Jailbird: Escape prison once and get sent back

steps.title: There are a few activities you should avoid after a prison break.
steps.content: There are a few activities you should avoid after a prison break. These activities will get you sent back to prison, where you'll have to try and escape all over again. Returning to your home country after emigrating Enlisting in the military Calling the police for anything Getting caught committing another crime
